required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase I/II Clinical Trial of Vorinostat in Combination With Erlotinib for Patients With Relapsed/Refractory Non-Small-Cell Lung Cancer (0683-025)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Clinical Trial of Oral Vorinostat (MK0683) in Combination With Erlotinib in Patients With Relapsed/Refractory Non-Small-Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The reason for this study will be to find the safest maximum tolerated dose of oral vorinostat in combination with erlotinib [Tarceva (TM)] that can be given to patients with lung cancer who have relapsed or failed other therapy for the disease. Once the safest maximum tolerated dose of vorinostat is determined, patients enrolled in the clinical trial will continue vorinostat and erlotinib for up to 8 months. Safety and effectiveness will also be evaluated.

clinical_study.why_stopped: This trial is being closed based on lack of substantive efficacy, slow accrual and overall tolerance in patients treated to date.

primary_outcome.measure: Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT) Occurring in Cycle 1 of the Phase I Portion of the Study
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 28 in the Phase I portion of the study
primary_outcome.description: Adverse event(s) that determined the treatment dose level was not tolerable for that patient in Cycle 1 of the Phase I portion of the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Dose Limiting Toxicity Occurring in Cycle 1 of the Phase II Portion of the Study
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 28 in the Phase II portion of the study
primary_outcome.description: Adverse event(s) that determined the treatment dose level was not tolerable for that patient in Cycle 1 of the Phase II portion of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Unconfirmed Partial Response (UPR) Based on Response Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 57 days beginning with Cycle 3, or more frequently if appropriate
secondary_outcome.description: An unconfirmed partial response is defined as a partial response that has not been confirmed by a follow up CT scan (or MRI) at least 4 weeks after the criteria for response are first met. (A partial response is defined as an at least 30% reduction in the sum of the longest diameter of the target lesions. Non-target lesions must be at least stable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Stable Disease (SD) as Best Response Based on Response Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 57 days beginning with Cycle 3, or more frequently if appropriate
secondary_outcome.description: Stable disease is defined as less than a radiographic partial response, but not progressive disease

secondary_outcome.measure: Progressive Disease (PD) as Best Response Based on Response Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 57 days beginning with Cycle 3, or more frequently if appropriate
secondary_outcome.description: Progressive disease is defined as a ≥20% increase in the sum of the longest diameter, the appearance of one or more new lesions and/or unequivocal progression of non-target lesions by conventional or spiral CT or MRI

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease Progression After Week 8 Based on Response Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 57 days beginning with Cycle 3 (Week 8), or more frequently if appropriate
secondary_outcome.description: First documentation of Progressive Disease (PD) occurring > 8 weeks on study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to disease progression or death
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival was measured from the start of the treatment to the time when the criteria for progression was met or death due to any cause (whichever is first recorded).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Vorinostat 200 mg b.i.d. 3d/wk + Erlotinib 150 mg q.d. 7d/wk
arm_group.description: Vorinostat 200 mg twice a day for 3 days a week + erlotinib 150 mg once a day was evaluated in the Phase I portion of the study and determined to be the MTD and therefore the recommended Phase II dose. Of the 16 patients treated at this dose level, 4 were assigned to the Phase I portion of the study and 12 were assigned to the Phase II portion

arm_group.arm_group_label: Vorinostat 300 mg q.d. 3d/wk + Erlotinib 150 mg q.d. 7d/wk
arm_group.description: Vorinostat 300 mg once a day for 3 days a week + erlotinib 150 mg once a day was evaluated in the Phase I portion of the amended study and exceeded the MTD. All patients treated at this dose level were assigned to the Phase I portion of the study.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Vorinostat 300 mg b.i.d. 3d/wk + Erlotinib 150 mg q.d. 7d/wk
arm_group.description: Vorinostat 300 mg twice a day for 3 days a week + erlotinib 150 mg once a day was evaluated in the Phase I portion of the study and exceeded the MTD. All patients treated at this dose level were assigned to the Phase I portion of the study.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Vorinostat 400 mg q.d. 21d/4wk + Erlotinib 150 mg q.d. 7d/wk
arm_group.description: Vorinostat 400 mg once a day for 21 out of 28 days + erlotinib 150 mg once a day was evaluated in the Phase I portion of the original study and exceeded MTD. This cohort was then amended (Amendment 1) to identify a more tolerable once daily vorinostat dosing regimen. All patients treated at this dose level were assigned to the Phase I portion of the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females 18 years of age and older with a confirmed diagnosis of non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who have failed at least one prior treatment for NSCLC.
- Patients must have proven disease by CT scan or MRI.
- Patients must be at least 4 weeks from any chemotherapy for cancer or from any surgeries or from any treatment using an investigational drug.
- Patients must be 2 weeks out from radiation therapy.
- At screening the patient must have normal lab results and can not be pregnant.
- Women and men must agree to practice adequate birth control during the study.
- Patient has the ability to understand and sign the consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient had prior treatment with vorinostat or erlotinib.
- Patient has any of the following conditions: active infections including hepatitis B or C, unstable brain metastases, swallowing difficulties, heart problems, significant eye abnormalities, drug or alcohol abuse, mental illness or pregnancy.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This study was conducted at 12 investigative sites in the United States. The first patient’s first visit was 30 March 2006. The study was terminated early on 12 Oct 2007 and the last patient’s last visit was 30 Oct 2007.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Enrolled patients were assigned to 1 of 2 dose escalating cohorts (A and B) in the Phase I portion of the study to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD). Once determined, new patients were assigned to the Phase II portion of the study and treated with the MTD. Active Phase I patients continued into Phase II.

group.title: Vorinostat 200 mg b.i.d. 3d/wk + Erlotinib 150 mg q.d. 7d/wk
group.description: Vorinostat 200 mg twice a day for 3 days a week + erlotinib 150 mg once a day was evaluated in the Phase I portion of the study and determined to be the MTD and therefore the recommended Phase II dose. Of the 16 patients treated at this dose level, 4 were assigned to the Phase I portion of the study and 12 were assigned to the Phase II portion.

measure.title: Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT) Occurring in Cycle 1 of the Phase I Portion of the Study
measure.description: Adverse event(s) that determined the treatment dose level was not tolerable for that patient in Cycle 1 of the Phase I portion of the study.
measure.population: All patients as treated population in Cycle 1 of the Phase I portion of the study.

outcome.title: Unconfirmed Partial Response (UPR) Based on Response Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST)
outcome.description: An unconfirmed partial response is defined as a partial response that has not been confirmed by a follow up CT scan (or MRI) at least 4 weeks after the criteria for response are first met. (A partial response is defined as an at least 30% reduction in the sum of the longest diameter of the target lesions. Non-target lesions must be at least stable)
outcome.time_frame: Every 57 days beginning with Cycle 3, or more frequently if appropriate
outcome.population: All patients as treated population with post-baseline data available to determine Unconfirmed Partial Response as Best Response.

group.title: Vorinostat 200 mg b.i.d. 3d/wk + Erlotinib 150 mg q.d. 7d/wk

outcome.title: Progression-free Survival
outcome.description: Progression-free survival was measured from the start of the treatment to the time when the criteria for progression was met or death due to any cause (whichever is first recorded).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to disease progression or death
outcome.population: All patients as treated population with post-baseline data available to determine progression free survival. Cohort A, Dose Level 1 (Amended), Cohort B, Dose Level 2 and Cohort A, Dose Level 1 (Original) are not represented in the below table as post-baseline data were not available to determine progression free survival.

Of the 16 patients treated at this dose level, 4 were assigned to the Phase I portion of the study and 12 were assigned to the Phase II portion.

group.title: Vorinostat 300 mg q.d. 3d/wk + Erlotinib 150 mg q.d. 7d/wk
group.description: Vorinostat 300 mg once a day for 3 days a week + erlotinib 150 mg once a day was evaluated in the Phase I portion of the amended study and exceeded the MTD. All patients treated at this dose level were assigned to the Phase I portion of the study.

group.title: Vorinostat 300 mg b.i.d. 3d/wk + Erlotinib 150 mg q.d. 7d/wk
group.description: Vorinostat 300 mg twice a day for 3 days a week + erlotinib 150 mg once a day was evaluated in the Phase I portion of the study and exceeded the MTD. All patients treated at this dose level were assigned to the Phase I portion of the study.

group.title: Vorinostat 400 mg q.d. 21d/4wk + Erlotinib 150 mg q.d. 7d/wk
group.description: Vorinostat 400 mg once a day for 21 out of 28 days + erlotinib 150 mg once a day was evaluated in the Phase I portion of the original study and exceeded MTD. This cohort was then amended (Amendment 1) to identify a more tolerable once daily vorinostat dosing regimen. All patients treated at this dose level were assigned to the Phase I portion of the study.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Due to the slow pace of patient accrual, failure to observe meaningful efficacy in treated patients, and overall intolerance of the combination regimen, the study was terminated prematurely on 12-Oct-2007.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
